channel.title: B&W
channel.description:
I used to draw a few times a week, but I've dropped the hobby half a year ago. I've just started again this past week, wish me luck. :stuck_out_tongue:
I don't have time to scan my sketchbook atm, but here's my favorite drawing, the [b]Teaman[/b]. Made 8/31/08, about 2 hours. 300 dpi for printing
[img]https://hosting06.imagecross.com/image-hosting-07/6934teaman4.jpg[/img]

item.title: B&W
item.dc:creator: Trilby
item.description:
Something new:

A quick little concept art for a world I have in mind.
Same one I’ve got screenshots of in this thread.
About 40-ish minutes, pencil + ink. I need narrower pens, hahahaha

It’s not an accurate description of any place in the world. It’s meant to give the viewer an idea of how a mid-size city in the world might look like.

As to that extent, I think that my idea of the world’s cities is a little small.

Something old, from August 2008

Cyber Chief

My first real attempt at making a good pic all on a computer.
It was meant to be a desktop background.
There’s many things wrong with it, but I am still proud of it, for a first.
Unfortunately I got bored, and then lost the USB drive that had the editable.

when I saw the Teaman I instantly thought about saving it so I could remember later. I’d photoshop it to have background of something like Hong Kong for a desktop but i would feel wrong about doing that to such a beautiful piece.

Go right ahead, I’d love to see it!

I might remake it sometime, but I don’t usually return to bettering old stuff.
If I find the USB with my old editables, the chances of me remaking it would go up.

Dias:

Have you even seen the Immolator? This thing looks like a twig in comparison.


Yeah… hmm… I don’t know. The Immolator looks so unwieldy and its barrel looks so flimsy. Both guns are fine, I suppose.

And because I drew the fuel supply hose as connecting to the “stock” of the gun instead of angling the bottom or some such, both would be used in the same stance - as if using a leaf blower.

TOTALLY INTENTIONAL

Read full topic

item.title: B&W
item.dc:creator: Trilby
item.description:
My birthday just happened. I’m 16. It was an above average day, but the party I’ve got together for Saturday is gonna blow it out of the waters. :pirate:

On a more relevant note… I don’t have any new drawings. But! I’m working on a plague doctor. It’s looking great.

Hmm… what to post? Something out of the archives but that also reflects my current ability… Aha!

Here’s a nice crop of a screenshot from the game I’m making. Though it’s not much, I like how it turned out. Also of the Feb 03 build.

And here’s some ASCII art. This one’s pretty aged. One of the few I’ve ever made. I think it’s the skull panda from the Sam&Max webcomic. I don’t even remember what the comic was about anymore.

item.title: B&W
item.dc:creator: Trilby
item.description:
Caption: “Scepter DM, GMClans / April 21, 2008”

Link to 600 dpi version (4.0 MB )

Here’s the “cool sketch” I was talking about. 2 or 3 days, about an hour each day. It was made for a “daily mission” at this indie game dev community I used to frequent. (It’s dead now. :[ )

This scan has not been edited. I only cleaned up a few stray pencil smudges. I thought about adjusting the levels, but I think I’ll pass for this one. It’s too easy to make a mistake. The paper original is darker than the one on screen.

Comment!

Read full topic

item.title: B&W
item.dc:creator: Trilby
item.description:
It’s too late to scan that cool sketch. I got an exam tomorrow. So, a repost.

Trilby:
Bob Nintendo:

Arctic Cremator. Instead of a flamethrower, a freezy-water-gun-type-thing.

Trilby delivers.

The gun’s like totally convertible. Flame? Ice? How about ice that’s on fire.

Yum. That took about three hours and then some. I drew half of it during school (the easy [top] half). Very fun times. The gun was a bitch though. I couldn’t get it just right for a long while.

As promised: link to the 300 dpi version.

Basically a more durable version of the Cremator’s coat, with a less flimsy weapon. Hehe I’m suddenly reminded of the gluon gun

Psyborg:

I like this Trilby fellow. Not only does he draw well, he does stuff involving Morrowind, a far superior drink to meths. The wankers don’t drink it because they can’t afford it. fantastic game.

I go for the hard stuff.

Ramirezoid:

Printed out the Prowlsquid. All your shit is so dang fresh, yo.:jizz:

Mm say that again. Sounds so sexy.

OldDirtyBastard:

Anyway, pretty damn nice skills. Did you attend studio lessons or something in that direction?
Or are you self-educated?

I got a bit of talent. My dad went to art school himself when he was about my age. But he didn’t teach me anything directly, though he does encourage me. I remember he tried to teach me watercolors, but that didn’t get anywhere.

I took one year of art in highschool, Freshman year. (I’m just about done with Sophomore.) It helped my shading a good deal. Also it let me practice my quick-drawing on a regular basis: it was a first period class, and we practiced object drawing almost every day and I often slept through a good 30 of the 50 minutes. 20 minutes is definitely in the quick-draw range.

The sketch I keep talking about wanting to post, is basically the culmination of the quick-draw lessons. I did it for myself, not for the class (well partly to show off, really). But it took a lot longer than 20 min, and it’s also based off a photo, not a live object.

Other than that, I just draw a lot. Especially from reference, because that’s how I learn. The trick is to use the reference in clever new contexts.

Read full topic

item.title: B&W
item.dc:creator: Trilby
item.description:
First, a repost:

Trilby:
Ramirezoid:

Combine Prowler and Bullsquid.

Trilby delivers

OH SHIT ITS A NINJA CTHULHU RUN

That was drawn with a No. 2 pencil. I scanned it, blended the strokes together, lightly, adjusted levels, blended the spots I missed. Then, I took the original scan, and superimposed it on the blended-leveled layer. On the orig-scan layer, I set the blending option to multiply and the opacity to about 85. This procedure gave it a smooth look while maintaining texture.

Making this pic took the better part of 2 hours. Maybe more. But damn it was fun! I feel like summer break has already begun

I wanted to post this really cool drawing I made, but I realized that I lost the USB which stored it… half a year ago. Irksome! Ah well, I have it hanging just above my monitor. I’ll scan it tomorrow.

[Edit: I forgot! Here’s the 300 dpi version of the Bullsquid-prowler above.]

In the meanwhile, I’ll have to content myself with this little tidbit I made. It’s a CSS-design element. It’s used like a wreath would be. Except it’s cooler than a wreath.

Here’s a shot of it in action

Do comment! I feel awkward multi-posting. Not awkward enough to not do it, of course.

Read full topic

item.title: B&W
item.dc:creator: Trilby
item.description:
Concept sketch for the game 7 posts back.

It’s a mining facility on a rockbelt. There are little droids, latched onto the rocks, mining minerals; and there are mining shuttles, carting the minerals from the droids to be stored. There’s a docking bay at the bottom of the facility, with two freight airships currently docked.

The rockbelt is a collection of free-floating rocks. It drifts through a gas-giant’s atmosphere, pushed by air currents.

Read full topic

item.title: B&W
item.dc:creator: Trilby
item.description:
I’ve been busy studying for exams lately. Here’s a page from my sketchbook.

It’s a doodle gone to the next level. It evolved, from a table to a unicycle to this. Of course the wheels are off-center, they were meant to be tables, but they’d never roll anyway because they are elliptical.

I call it the Uberbike

@Keresh: I actually got a very good screenshot. It was outside, and the fps was lagging, so the FPS Optimizer reduced the viewdistance to minimum. What’s happening there, is that the fog is leeching into the model.
I used Photoshop to clone away areas of sky that were showing in 2-3 places.

@§pitƒire: Thank you very much!

Read full topic
